subject: log_services: Add download of post code log entries
commitMessage:
log_services: Add download of post code log entries

- Add a GET method /redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/PostCodes
  /Entries/<str>/attachment/, Get the attribute value through the
  getPostCodes method and encode it as base64, and send it off.

- This allows the use to offload error logs for analysis and further
  parsing if needed. An http header of "Accept:
  application/octet-stream" or the default "*/*" is expected.

Tested:
- Ran Redfish validator.

- pldmtool raw --data 0x80 0x3F 0xC 0x0A 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x07 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x48 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x02 0x00 0x00 0x01 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x48 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x00 0x53 0x54 0x41 0x4e 0x44 0x42 0x59 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20 0x20

$curl -k https://127.0.0.1:2443/redfish/v1/Systems/system/LogServices/PostCodes/Entries/B1-1/attachment/
output:
AgAAAQAAAEgAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAFNUQU5EQlkgICAgICAgICAgICAgICAgICAgICAgICAg

Signed-off-by: George Liu <liuxiwei@inspur.com>
Change-Id: I74dd6c1dc2d3dfb7908f7741e0d9e7825c1df816

Change has been successfully rebased and submitted as af61db10fb40c7beb91a70f0b3ff28cb8e6c1704 by George Liu
Passing an id in an unexpected format sounds more like a user error than internal error, would a resourceNotFound (404) be more appropriate? Here and all the rest that check for the format of the id.
And I assume after you decode base64 you get the same as the pldmtool raw ?

I would think this would match something similar to below 
PostCodesEntryAdditionalData ?

I think there was a plan to remove std::regex from bmcweb, please look at why form the below issue:
https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/issues/176

magic numbers.

I suspect this function isn't needed.

> magic numbers.

Ack.

> I suspect this function isn't needed.

It needs to check whether `str` is a number.
see: https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/41125/10/redfish-core/lib/log_services.hpp#3421
Please use the appropriate parser for this from the beast library
This forces post codes to take a specific form in the dbus paths.  I suspect this wont be compatible with non-ibm systems.  I would expect to not need this when looking up dbus.

Sorry, This is not IBM specific.
The post codes are stored in the form B<BootNumber>-<PostCodeNumber>.
We did not create `B1-1`, its already there since long time, and even x86 systems are using it.

Because the end result of `base64Encoding` is a plain string, and it is encoded
`asyncResp->res.addHeader("Content-Transfer-Encoding", "Base64")`

These aren't guaranteed by the interface to be plain text, right?

Also, please deduplicate this block with the other block that you copied this from.
Please use from_chars here.  it's easier to use properly, and removes the need for the check on 3478
Potential underflow.  Fix your range check.

Yeah, I have checked it in two places:
1. L: 3511
2. https://gerrit.openbmc-project.xyz/c/openbmc/bmcweb/+/41125/14/redfish-core/lib/log_services.hpp#3493
Please put this in its own function.

Also, this can be its own function


With that said, using this very specific interpretation of the resource uri worries me a little.
You copied this code from somewhere (I forget where, but it looks familiar).  Please deduplicate it.
Yeah, I have defined as a method
Please case current value first, then check the range on line 3518
Need to check this has data at all.  If it doesn't what should the behavior be?  I'm not sure

I don’t think it should be an error if there is no data。
I need to print information and return directly.

Ack

> I don’t think it should be an error if there is no data。

We disagree.  If there's no data, but there's supposed to be that should be 404.  (I think).

> I need to print information and return directly.
> 
> Ack

> We disagree.  If there's no data, but there's supposed to be that should be 404.  (I think).

Ack
Just optional: The function is checking if octet is accepted, so the function name could be more specific, like isOctetAccepted.

This is the wrong file for this.  http_utility.hpp seems like a better spot.

You'll also see that we have a "requestPrefersHtml" method there.  I suspect this needs to be combined with that one, as this is the more generic form (I think).  Lets discuss more once you have it moved.

Please don't add member functions like this that don't use any member variables.  The Node class is in the process of being removed, and methods like this make it harder.

https://github.com/openbmc/bmcweb/issues/181
output isn't used on stack.  Can you just do this in one line and avoid the move entirely?
